36 /// Represent OpenGL floating point colour: Red, Green and Blue with alpha.
37 struct Colour
38 {
39  /// Default constructs white.
40  inline Colour()
41  : red(1.0), green(1.0), blue(1.0), alpha(1.0)
42  {
43  }
44 
45  /// Construct from component values
46  inline Colour(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha = 1.0)
47  : red(red), green(green), blue(blue), alpha(alpha)
48  {
49  }
50 
51  /// Construct from rgba array.
52  inline Colour(float rgba[4])
53  {
54  r = rgba[0];
55  g = rgba[1];
56  b = rgba[2];
57  a = rgba[3];
58  }
59 
60  /// Return pointer to OpenGL compatible RGBA array.
61  inline float* Get()
62  {
63  return c;
64  }
65 
66  /// Return this colour with alpha adjusted.
67  inline Colour WithAlpha(float alpha)
68  {
69  return Colour(r,g,b,alpha);
70  }
71 
72  /// Construct from HSV Colour
73  /// @param hue Colour hue in range [0,1]
74  /// @param sat Saturation in range [0,1]
75  /// @param val Value / Brightness in range [0,1].
76  static inline Colour Hsv(float hue, float sat = 1.0, float val = 1.0, float alpha = 1.0)
77  {
78  const float h = 6.0f * hue;
79  const int i = (int)floor(h);
80  const float f = (i%2 == 0) ? 1-(h-i) : h-i;
81  const float m = val * (1-sat);
82  const float n = val * (1-sat*f);
83 
84  switch(i)
85  {
86  case 0: return Colour(val,n,m,alpha);
87  case 1: return Colour(n,val,m,alpha);
88  case 2: return Colour(m,val,n,alpha);
89  case 3: return Colour(m,n,val,alpha);
90  case 4: return Colour(n,m,val,alpha);
91  case 5: return Colour(val,m,n,alpha);
92  default:
93  throw std::runtime_error("Found extra colour in rainbow.");
94  }
95  }
96 
97  union {
98  struct {
99  float red;
100  float green;
101  float blue;
102  float alpha;
103  };
104  struct {
105  float r;
106  float g;
107  float b;
108  float a;
109  };
110  float c[4];
111  };
112 
113 };

115 /// A ColourWheel is like a continuous colour palate that can be sampled.
116 /// In the future, different ColourWheels will be supported, but this one
117 /// is based on sampling hues in HSV colourspace. An indefinite number of
118 /// unique colours are sampled using the golden angle.
119 class ColourWheel
120 {
121 public:
122  /// Construct ColourWheel with Saturation, Value and Alpha constant.
123  inline ColourWheel(float saturation=0.5, float value=1.0, float alpha = 1.0)
124  : unique_colours(0), sat(saturation), val(value), alpha(alpha)
125  {
126 
127  }
128 
129  /// Use Golden ratio (/angle) to pick well spaced colours.
130  inline Colour GetColourBin(int i) const
131  {
132  float hue = i * 0.5f * (3.0f - sqrt(5.0f));
133  hue -= (int)hue;
134  return Colour::Hsv(hue,sat,val,alpha);
135  }
136 
137  /// Return next unique colour from ColourWheel.
138  inline Colour GetUniqueColour()
139  {
140  return GetColourBin(unique_colours++);
141  }
142 
143 protected:
144  int unique_colours;
145  float sat;
146  float val;
147  float alpha;
148 };
149 
150 }
